title: Order Management System Design
content:
# Order Management System Design

## Order Lifecycle

### States
PENDING → CONFIRMED → PROCESSING → SHIPPED → DELIVERED → COMPLETED

### State Transitions
- PENDING: Payment initiated
- CONFIRMED: Payment successful
- PROCESSING: Warehouse fulfilling
- SHIPPED: Package with carrier
- DELIVERED: Customer received
- COMPLETED: Return window closed

Alternative paths:
- CANCELLED: Any time before SHIPPED
- RETURNED: After DELIVERED

## Database Schema
```sql
CREATE TABLE orders (
  order_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id VARCHAR(50),
  status VARCHAR(20),
  total_amount DECIMAL(10,2),
  created_at TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE order_items (
  item_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  order_id VARCHAR(50),
  product_id VARCHAR(50),
  quantity INT,
  price DECIMAL(10,2)
);
```

## Event-Driven Architecture
Events published to Kafka:
- order.created
- order.confirmed
- order.shipped
- order.delivered
- order.cancelled

Subscribers:
- Email service
- Analytics
- Inventory service
- Shipping service

## Business Rules
- Free shipping over $50
- Tax calculated based on shipping address
- Inventory reserved for 15 minutes
- Orders can be cancelled before PROCESSING
- Refunds processed within 5-7 days

## API Endpoints
GET /api/v1/orders/{order_id}
POST /api/v1/orders
PUT /api/v1/orders/{order_id}/cancel
GET /api/v1/orders?customer_id={id}

## Performance
- 99.9% uptime
- <200ms order creation
- Handle 1000 orders/minute peak
- Database sharded by customer_id
